data.class-stable-baselines3#class stable-bas:
As a reference design, our AI agent directly loads the state-of-the-art models from the stable-baselines3.
import netaigym.env as env
from stable_baselines3 import PPO

env = env("nqos_split")
model = PPO("MlpPolicy", vec_env, verbose=1)
model.learn(total_timesteps=25000)
model.save("nqos_split")

Prior to initiating a simulation, the agent parameters, denoted as "rl_agent_config", can be customized using JSON files.
For instance, the nqos_split_config.json file is utilized to configure the nqos_split network environment.
Moreover, the available options are listed in the "rl_agent_config_option_list" section of the JSON file. A list of configurable parameters for our agent is listed in the following table.
Parameter	Description	agent	select agent, e.g., "PPO", "DDPG". Set to "" will disable agent, i.e., use the system's default algorithm for offline data collection	policy	selet policy	train	set to "true" to train model, set to "false" to test saved model	reward_type	select reward function	input	select "matrix" or "flat" input type for observations

data.class-netaigymclient#class netaigym.clie:
netaigym client software includes the three components, a customized gymnasium.env, adapter and northbound_api.
The customized gymnasium.env inherets the environment class of gymnasium and communicates with the agent using the standard gymnasium interfaces. E.g., exchange obs, reward and action in the reset() and step() functions.


import gymnasium as gym
class netaigym_env(gym.Env):
"""Custom Environment that follows gym interface."""

def __init__(self, arg1, arg2, ...):
super().__init__()
...

def step(self, action):
...
return observation, reward, terminated, truncated, info

def reset(self, seed=None, options=None):
...
return observation, info

The adapter transform the data format from gymnasium to netaigym or the other way around. E.g., it transforms network stats to obs and reward, and changes action to policy.
The northbound_api connects the client to the server, configure the environment parameters, communicate network stats and policy between client and netaigym envrionment.

data.class-netaigymclientnorthbound_api#class: The northbound_api connects the client to the server, configure the environment parameters, communicate network stats and policy between client and netaigym envrionment.
data.methods#Methods:
netaigym.client.northbound_api.connect(self)

Connect to the netaigym environment via netaigym server.

netaigym.client.northbound_api.send(self, policy: JSON)

Send the policy to the netaigym envrionment.

netaigym.client.northbound_api.recv(self) -> network_stats: list[pandas.DataFrame]

Receive the network stats from the netaigym environment.
data.attributes#Attributes:
Network Environment Simulation Parameters
Prior to initiating a simulation for a network environment, the network environment parameters, denoted as "gmasim_config", can be customized using JSON files.
For instance, the nqos_split_config.json file is utilized to configure the nqos_split environment.
It's important to note that certain parameters may only be relevant to specific subsets of environments.
For example, the parameter "slice_list" is exclusively applicable to the Cellular RAN Slicing environment.
Parameter	Description	simulation_time_s	simulation time in seconds	random_run	change the random seed for this simulation	downlink	set to true to simulate downlink data flow, set to false to simulate uplink data flow	max_wait_time_for_action_ms	the max time the netaisim worker will wait for an action. set to -1 will cap the wait time to 100 seconds.	enb_locations	x, y and z locations of the base station, we support 1 base station only	ap_locations	x, y and z location of the Wi-Fi access point, add or remove element in this list to increase or reduce AP number. We support no AP as well	num_users	the number of users	slice_list	network slicing environment only, resouce block group (rbg) size maybe 1, 2, 3 or 4, it depends on the resource block num, see table 7.1.6.1-1 of 36.213	user_left_right_speed_m/s	user speed (m/s). Users only move to left or right. When a user reaches the doundry, it reverse the direction	user_location_range	initially, users will be randomly deployed within this x, y range. if user_left_right_speed_m > 0, the user will move left and right within this boundary	app_and_measurement_start_time_ms	when the application starts traffic and send measurement to RL agent	transport_protocol	tcp or udp	min_udp_rate_per_user_mbps	if "transport_protocol" is "udp", this para controls the min sending rate	max_udp_rate_per_user_mbps	if "transport_protocol" is "udp", this para controls the max sending rate	qos_requirement:test_duration_ms	duration for qos testing	qos_requirement:delay_bound_ms	max delay for qos flow	qos_requirement:delay_violation_target	delay violation target for qos flow	qos_requirement:loss_target	loss target for qos flow	GMA:downlink_mode	"auto", "split", or "steer". "auto" will config UDP and TCP ACK as steer and TCP data as split	GMA:uplink_mode	"auto", "split", or "steer". "auto" will config UDP and TCP ACK as steer and TCP data as split	GMA:measurement_interval_ms	duration of a measurement interval for GMA	GMA:measurement_guard_interval_ms	gap between 2 measurement interval for GMA	GMA:respond_action_after_measurement	whether to response action after receiving measurement, do not change it	Wi-Fi:ap_share_same_band	set to true, ap will share the same frequency band	Wi-Fi:measurement_interval_ms	duration of a measurement interval for Wi-Fi	Wi-Fi:measurement_guard_interval_ms	gap between 2 measurement interval for Wi-Fi	LTE:qos_aware_scheduler	qos_steer environment only, set to true to enable qos aware scheduler for LTE	LTE:resource_block_num	number of resouce blocks for LTE, 25 for 5 MHZ, 50 for 10 MHZ, 75 for 15 MHZ and 100 for 20 MHZ	LTE:measurement_interval_ms	duration of a measurement interval for LTE	LTE:measurement_guard_interval_ms	gap between 2 measurement interval for LTE


Network Stats
At the end of each measurement interval, the netaigym API communicates the following networks stats measurement to the client.
The client will use the adapter to transform these measurements into observations and rewards.
Measurement	Unit	Description	max_rate	mbps	LTE/Wi-Fi link capacity measured by each user	load	mbps	input traffic throughput measured by each user	rate	mbps	output traffic throughput measured by each user, including LTE, Wi-Fi, and ALL	qos_rate	mbps	output traffic throughput that meet the QoS requirement measured by each user, including LTE, Wi-Fi, and ALL	owd	ms	one-way delay measured by each user, including LTE, Wi-Fi, and ALL	tsu		traffic split ratio measured by each user, including LTE, Wi-Fi	ap_id		access-point/cell ID measured by each user, including LTE and Wi-Fi	slice_id		LTE slice ID measured by each user	rb_usage	%	LTE resource block usage percentage (%) measured by each user	delay_violation	%	packet One-way delay violation percentage (%) measured by each user



Network Environment/Policy
When the agent returns a action, the netaigym client utilizes the adapter to convert the action to policy, which will be applied to the netaigym environment.
Environment	Policy	Description	nqos_split: Multi-Access (MX) Traffic Splitting	Traffic Splitting	The agent updates traffic split ratio over Wi-Fi and LTE for each user	qos_steer: QoS-aware MX Traffic Steering	Traffic Steering	The agent steers traffic over Wi-Fi or LTE for each user	network_slicing: Cellular RAN Slicing	Resource Allocation	The agent updates LTE resource block allocation ratio for a slice

data.class-netaigymenv#class netaigym.env:
netaigym.env includes the two components, a southbound_api, and a simulator: NetAISim.
The southbound_api connects the env to the server, receives the environment parameters, communicate network stats and policy between env and server.
At present, we only support NetAISim simulator. The emulator and testbed option will be released in the future.


At present, we do not plan to release the netaigym.env.

data.class-netaigymclientadapter#class netaig:
The adapter transform the data format from gymnasium to netaigym or the other way around. E.g., it transforms network stats to obs and reward, and changes action to policy.
The methods that perform the data transformation is provided in the following section.
data.methods#Methods:
netaigym.client.adapter.action_to_policy(self, action: ActType) -> policy: JSON

In the step() function, call this function to transform the action format from the Gymnasium action datatype: Spaces to the policy: JSON, then send to the netaigym environment.

netaigym.client.adapter.network_stats_to_obs(self, network_stats: list[pandas.DataFrame]) -> obs: ObsType

In the reset() and step() functions, call this function to transform network stats: list[pandas.DataFrame] measured from netaigym environment to the Gymnasium observation datatype: Spaces.

netaigym.client.adapter.network_stats_to_reward(self, network_stats: list[pandas.DataFrame]) -> reward

In the reset() and step() functions, call this function to transform network stats: list[pandas.DataFrame] measured from netaigym environment to the Gymnasium reward datatype: Spaces.

data.class-netaigymclientsouthbound_api#class: At present, we do not plan to release the netaigym.client.southbound_api.

data:
An environment must be selected when launching the python client. The supported [ENV] is provided in the following table.
python3 main_rl.py --env=[ENV]

ENV	Policy	Description	nqos_split	Traffic Splitting	Multi-Access (MX) Traffic Splitting: The agent controls the traffic split ratio over Wi-Fi and LTE for each user	qos_steer	Traffic Steering	QoS-aware MX Traffic Steering: The agent steers traffic over Wi-Fi or LTE for each user	network_slicing	RAN Resource Allocation	Cellular RAN Slicing: The agent selects the dedicated, prioritzed, shared resource block groups for a slice

data.netaisim#NetAISim:
NetAISim is a ns-3 based network simualtor with advanced features such as multi-access traffic management, network slicing, etc.
At present, we do not plan to release the NetAISim.

data.get-access-to-netaigym-testbed-via-vlab#:
We have hosted NetAIGym Env (NetAIServer and NetAISim) on vLab machines to collaborate with MLWiNS/RINGs universities.
By utilizing the NetAIGym Open API, a NetAIClient can establish a connection with the NetAIGym Environment through either the public internet or Intel's internal network.
If you have any issue getting access to vLab, please reach out to us at netaigym@gmail.com.Next, we plan to launch NetAIGym Sim-aaS via Intel DevCloud and make it available for all Intel developers.
In the meantime, we are collaborating with the research community to enhance NetAISim with new use-cases & capabilities, e.g., 5G/O-RAN, distributed computing, RAN energy saving, predictive QoS, etc.
data.launch-your-first-network-ai-simulation#:
After acquiring early access to NetAIGym, you can proceed to download the client software, NetAIClient, in order to initiate your initial simulation.
For additional information regarding the client software, please refer to the NetAIClient Github Repository.
data.Ô∏è-upon-starting-the-netaiclient-the-fo: The NetAIClient initiates by sending a JSON configure file to the NetAIServer, triggering the launch of an ns-3 simulation.
data.-during-the-simulation-the-process-repea:
NetAISim collects measurement metrics and transmits them to the NetAIServer.
The NetAIServer forwards the measurements to the NetAIClient using the NetAIGym Open API.


An Algorithm Agent, which could be either AI or non-AI, computes an action based on the received measurements and stores relevant data in WandB.
The NetAIClient transmits the computed action to the NetAISim through the NetAIGym Open API, enabling the simulation to continue with the new action.
data.Ô∏è-when-the-netaiclient-or-the-simulati: The data stored in Wandb can be conveniently visualized on the Wandb website.

data:
In this example, we will guide you through the step-by-step procedure of initiating a simulation for the multi-access traffic splitting environment.
Within this case, the agent performs the following action at regular intervals: it updates the traffic split ratio for each user, considering both Wi-Fi and LTE connections.
data.prerequisite#Prerequisite: Make sure you have the access to the NetAIGym Vlab Access (contact us for more information) and downloaded the NetAIClient

data.class-netaigymserver#class netaigym.serv:
The netaigym server includes two components, the northbound manages the connections with the clients, and the southbound manages the connections with the environments.
When a client connects, the server selects an idle environment instance and add the client to envrionment mapping to the routing table.
At present, we do not plan to release the netaigym.server.

data:
News

Stay tuned for NetAIGym's news update.

The netaigym offers northbound API for the netaigym.client to select and configure network environment.
netaigym also provides environment specific adapters to transform the netaigym dataformat to the gymnasium data format, then interact with the gymnasium compatible agents such as stable-baselines3 and cleanRL.
At present, netaigym caters to Three distinct network environments (policy) and provides support for Ten different network stats measurement metrics.
The southbound API that bridges the netaigym server and environment will be released in the future.

Introducing NetAIGym (Network AI Gym), an open Simulation-as-a-Service framework to revolutionize Network AI Research and Development. NetAIGym comprises three key components, each playing a vital role in the framework:


NetAIClient: This Python-based interface that offers researchers and developers a comprehensive development environment following the Open AI Gym/Gymnasium standards.
It caters to the development of both AI and non-AI algorithms, empowering users with a versatile toolkit such as Stable-Baselines3 and WanDB.
NetAIGym API: Open API for collecting data and interacting with the simulated network environment.
NetAIGym Env (NetAIServer & NetAISim): Leverage open-source network simulation tools, e.g., ns-3; Enhance it with customized capabilities & use-cases, e.g. Traffic Steering, Network Slicing, Distributed Compute, Dynamic QoS, Energy Saving, etc.
data.Ô∏è-in-scope#‚úîÔ∏è In-Scope:
Develop open & reference AI models/algos for networking research (Layer 2 & above)
Develop abstract models, e.g. channel, compute, power, etc. for the physical world & system
Develop full-stack models to simulate E2E (Access/Edge/Cloud) network operation with high fidelity
data.-out-of-scope#‚ùå Out-of-Scope:
Develop proprietary AI algorithms or models
Develop AI application or software, e.g. xApp/rApp, etc., based on controller architecture, e.g. O-RAN RIC, etc.
Develop ‚ÄúDigital Twin‚Äù to simulate the physical world with high fidelity





Get started ‚Üí

data: Gymnasium is a standard API for reinforcement learning, and a diverse collection of reference environments.

ns-3 is a discrete-event network simulator for Internet systems, targeted primarily for research and educational use. ns-3 is free, open-source software, licensed under the GNU GPLv2 license, and maintained by a worldwide community.
data.ns-3-community#ns-3 community:
Number of publications involving ns-3: A search of the ‚Äòns-3 simulator‚Äô results on https://scholar.google.com
since 2017 (excluding patents and citations) yields¬†over 17,300 links¬†(with some false positives).
The ACM digital library lists 11,830 publications matching the search term ‚Äòns-3‚Äô (in abstract) since 2017(searched 6/15/23).
ns-3-users group: As of January 2018, there were¬†8183 members¬†of the¬†ns-3-users group. The number of posts to the ns-3-users group can be viewed¬†at this web page. In 2017, there were approximately¬†700 posts/month.
ns-developers mailing list: The¬†ns-developers mailing list¬†is where software development discussions take place. As of January 2018, there were¬†1560 subscribers¬†to this list.
Number of authors: As of ns-3.27 release,¬†220 people¬†are listed as authors in the¬†AUTHORS file.
Number of maintainers: ns-3 maintainers have responsibility and authority to oversee and maintain different portions of the codebase. As of ns-3.27 release,¬†23 people¬†are¬†listed as ns-3 maintainers.
Number of downloads: The project has not been maintaining counts of downloads for the past few years. In 2016 (the last year counted), ns-3 releases were downloaded approximately¬†72,000 times¬†from the main web server.

data: ZeroMQ (also spelled √òMQ, 0MQ or ZMQ) is a high-performance asynchronous messaging library, aimed at use in distributed or concurrent applications. It provides a message queue, but unlike message-oriented middleware, a ZeroMQ system can run without a dedicated message broker.ZeroMQ supports common messaging patterns (pub/sub, request/reply, client/server and others) over a variety of transports (TCP, in-process, inter-process, multicast, WebSocket and more), making inter-process messaging as simple as inter-thread messaging. This keeps your code clear, modular and extremely easy to scale.ZeroMQ is developed by a large community of contributors. There are third-party bindings for many popular programming languages and native ports for C# and Java.

data.network-ai-developer-challenges-why-neta:
real-world dataset controlled by network operator, difficult to acquire, not aligned with specific usage or requirement.
dataset by itself not enough, also need environment to train/test AI models, e.g. Reinforcement Learning, etc.
network simulation tools (e.g., ns3, etc.) often very complex and difficult to use, especially for Network AI researcher & developer.
lack of common simulation environment with simple APIs to develop, evaluate, and benchmark Network AI models & algorithms.

data: Stable Baselines3 (SB3) is a set of reliable implementations of reinforcement learning algorithms in PyTorch. It is the next major version of Stable Baselines.Github repository: https://github.com/DLR-RM/stable-baselines3Paper: https://jmlr.org/papers/volume22/20-1364/20-1364.pdfRL Baselines3 Zoo (training framework for SB3): https://github.com/DLR-RM/rl-baselines3-zooRL Baselines3 Zoo provides a collection of pre-trained agents, scripts for training, evaluating agents, tuning hyperparameters, plotting results and recording videos.SB3 Contrib (experimental RL code, latest algorithms): https://github.com/Stable-Baselines-Team/stable-baselines3-contrib
